summary:
In short: Committed, engaged, stress-resilient and versatile.
A quick thinker who thrives in an interdisciplinary setting where there is opportunity to consider what we do, why we do things and how to ensure our activities make a difference. 

I ensure results are achieved and plans do not get stuck in the boardroom, drawing on my solid (event) planning and project management experience, whilst being sensitive to the environment the organisation inhabits.

I subscribe to the UN Sustainable Development Goals. Ensuring my work adds real value to this world, and does not take away from others, is a personal priority. 

Also: a book reader, podcast listener, hobby chef and board game lover.

education.field_of_study: Art History, Media Studies, Linguistics, Anthropology

profile_positions.description:
Het Waterschap Drents Overijsselse Delta verbindt wonen, werken en natuur met water. Het werkgebied strekt van Deventer tot Assen; circa 630.000 inwoners in 22 gemeenten. Ik ben actief als deelprogrammamanager op de programma's Klimaatadaptatie en DuurzaamDoen. 

Binnen het deelprogramma Klimaatadaptatie focus ik mij specifiek op het projectmanagement Klimaatadaptatie voor RIVUS, een samenwerkingsregio van 8 gemeenten, de provincie Overijssel en het waterschap.

Het programma DuurzaamDoen richt zich op een energieneutraal, broeikasgasneutral en circulair waterschap in de (nabije) toekomst.

''We werken in een prachtig gebied en voelen de verantwoordelijkheid om daar zorgvuldig mee om te gaan. Zeker gezien ontwikkelingen zoals de klimaatverandering, die grote invloed heeft op de waterhuishouding. We zetten nieuwe manieren in om milieuvriendelijk en duurzaam te werken. Door inzet van zon- en windenergie, energie uit (riool)water en uit biomassa zoals maaisel, willen wij energieneutraal werken vanaf 2025 en een bijdrage leveren aan de circulaire economie. Lees meer hierover leest u op de pagina duurzaamheid en op de pagina Klimaat Actief!.''
profile_positions.title: Deelprogrammamanager (Klimaatadaptatie & Duurzaam Doen)

company.name: EAIE: European Association for International Education

profile_positions.company: EAIE: European Association for International Education
profile_positions.description:
The EAIE is the European centre for expertise, networking and resources in the internationalisation of higher education. We are a non-profit, member-led organisation serving individuals actively involved in the internationalisation of their institutions.

After several years in the EAIE’s events department, I have moved to a position focused on project- and process management of the association. Building on the knowledge gained of the association’s workings and its ambitions, I am able to contribute in other areas of association management:

Sparringpartner of the Executive Leadership Team; planning & priorities, advise, stakeholder management, awareness of strategic priorities and organisational sensitivities.

Facilitating development and implementation of the EAIE Strategey 2026; guiding focus of the Associations resources to where we are most effective and most needed by our community, as well as project management of structural projects to futureproof the organization. 

Championing sustainability initiatives, of practical nature as well as raising awareness and ensuring the SDGs and sustainability have a set place in our policy and strategy.

Managing the colleagues in the Association Support team; ensuring smooth cooperation and support of the Executive Leadership Team with regards to governance meetings, strategy development, planning, travel etc.
profile_positions.title: Project Officer & Team Lead Association Support team

profile_positions.company: EAIE: European Association for International Education
profile_positions.description:
Over the years I have developed to Senior Events Coordinator within the EAIE Events team. 
As part of the team I coordinate all conference logistics, worked on by several team members, for the annual conference and any other events that are organised by our team. I also support the Head of Events with bidding and sourcing procedures for future conferences and maintain industry relations.

The annual conference gathers over 5.500 higher education professionals, takes 4 days and the programme is filled with a large exhibition, over 150 sessions and workshops and 20+ networking events. Every aspect of the conference, aside exhibition management, is organised in-house. The conference is the most important source of income for the association, as well as the biggest platform to drive the mission and put important topics on the agenda of the sector.

The 2017 took place in Seville and the 2018 conference took place in Geneva.
profile_positions.title: Senior Events Coordinator

profile_positions.company: EAIE: European Association for International Education
profile_positions.description: The 2015 conference has taken place in Glasgow, and the 2016 conference took place in Liverpool.
profile_positions.title: Events Coordinator

profile_positions.company: EAIE: European Association for International Education
profile_positions.description: The 2014 conference took place in Prague.

profile_positions.description:
Barefoot Events & Communication provided event organisation, communications, project management and office support. As I preferred to be part of a team and hoped to contribute to organisations in broader sense, I discontinued the company. 

Congres Podiumkunsten, 26 & 27 May 2014 Vereniging van Schouwburgen en Concertgebouwdirecties (VSCD). Development and management of B2B sponsoring opportunities, ensuring the conference is financially viable.

Intertraffic beurs, Beter Benutten paviljoen, 25 -28 March 2014 - Dutch Ministry of infrastructure and environment. On-site management of the pavilion for the 'Beter Benutten' project. First point of contact for the exhibitors invited by the ministry on the pavilion.
profile_positions.title: Owner

volunteer_experiences.role: Staff member, accompanying the children for a week, cooking for 60 people.
volunteer_experiences.description:
LCKV youth camps is an 100-year-old organisation which provides week-long camps for children during the summer holidays; a week of camping (in a tent without warm water facilities!) and playing games together. These camps are traditionally kept very affordable and a number of children get to join for the symbolic amount of 1 euro ever year. 
A team of 15 volunteering adults joins every group of children (42) for the week. Over the last decade I have joined for six camps.

company.name: ICCA - Association Meetings Programme in Stavanger

volunteer_experiences.description: ICCA, the International Congress and Convention Association, organised a conference for their members and several Association delegates in order to learn from each other and network. Together with some colleagues, as part of the faculty, we worked on certain sessions and provided content on-stage and in face to face meetings during the conference.
